briefdescription.para: Initialize the App Framework for operation as a Bluetooth LE slave.
Initialize the App Framework for operation as a Bluetooth LE master.

description.para: Configure and send legacy, extended and periodic advertisements.

briefdescription.para: Set advertising type.
Set advertising peer address and its type.

Set advertising or scan data. Separate advertising and scan data can be set for connectable and discoverable modes. The application must allocate and maintain the memory pointed to by pData while the device is advertising.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the data. Maximum length is 31 bytes.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t location, uint8_t adType, uint8_t len, uint8_t *pValue)
memberdef.name: AppAdvSetAdValue

briefdescription.para: Set the value of an advertising data element in the advertising or scan response data. If the element already exists in the data then it is replaced with the new value. If the element does not exist in the data it is appended to it, space permitting.

detaileddescription.para: There is special handling for the device name (AD type DM_ADV_TYPE_LOCAL_NAME). If the name can only fit in the data if it is shortened, the name is shortened and the AD type is changed to DM_ADV_TYPE_SHORT_NAME.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the value. Maximum length is 29 bytes.

simplesect.para: true if the element was successfully added to the data, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Start advertising using the parameters for the given mode.
Stop advertising. The device will no longer be connectable or discoverable.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advType, uint8_t addrType, uint8_t *pAddr, appDbHdl_t dbHdl)
memberdef.name: AppConnAccept

briefdescription.para: Accept a connection to a peer device with the given address.
Check if the local device's currently advertising.

simplesect.para: true if device's advertising. false, otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Clear all bonding information on a slave device and make it bondable.

detaileddescription.para:
None.
\Note This API should not be used when Advertising (other than periodic advertising) is enabled. Otherwise, clearing the resolving list in the Controller may fail.

briefdescription.para: Set advertising peer address and its type for the given advertising set.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advHandle, uint8_t location, uint16_t len, uint8_t *pData, uint16_t bufLen)
memberdef.name: AppExtAdvSetData

briefdescription.para: Set extended advertising data.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the data. Maximum length is 31 bytes if advertising set uses legacy advertising PDUs with extended advertising.
Length of the data buffer maintained by Application. Minimum length is 31 bytes.

briefdescription.para: Start extended advertising using the parameters for the given mode.
Stop extended advertising. If the number of sets is set to 0 then all advertising sets are disabled.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advHandle, uint8_t location, uint8_t adType, uint8_t len, uint8_t *pValue)
memberdef.name: AppExtAdvSetAdValue

briefdescription.para: Set the value of an advertising data element in the extended advertising or scan response data. If the element already exists in the data then it is replaced with the new value. If the element does not exist in the data it is appended to it, space permitting.

detaileddescription.para: There is special handling for the device name (AD type DM_ADV_TYPE_LOCAL_NAME). If the name can only fit in the data if it is shortened, the name is shortened and the AD type is changed to DM_ADV_TYPE_SHORT_NAME.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the value. Maximum length is 31 bytes if advertising set uses legacy advertising PDUs with extended advertising.

simplesect.para: true if the element was successfully added to the data, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advHandle, uint8_t location, uint8_t adType, uint8_t len, uint8_t *pValue)
memberdef.name: AppExtAdvAppendAdValue

briefdescription.para: Append the value of an advertising data element to the extended advertising or scan response data. Regardless if the element already exists or doesn't in the data, it is appended with the element, space permitting.

detaileddescription.para: There is special handling for the device name (AD type DM_ADV_TYPE_LOCAL_NAME). If the name can only fit in the data if it is shortened, the name is shortened and the AD type is changed to DM_ADV_TYPE_SHORT_NAME.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the value. Maximum length is 31 bytes if advertising set uses legacy advertising PDUs with extended advertising.

simplesect.para: true if the element was successfully added to the data, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set extended advertising type.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advHandle, uint8_t advType, uint8_t addrType, uint8_t *pAddr, appDbHdl_t dbHdl)
memberdef.name: AppExtConnAccept

briefdescription.para: Accept a connection to a peer device with the given address using a given advertising set.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advHandle, uint16_t len, uint8_t *pData, uint16_t bufLen)
memberdef.name: AppPerAdvSetData

briefdescription.para: Set periodic advertising data.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the data buffer maintained by Application. Minimum length is 31 bytes.

briefdescription.para: Start periodic advertising for the given advertising handle.
Stop periodic advertising for the given advertising handle.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advHandle, uint8_t adType, uint8_t len, uint8_t *pValue)
memberdef.name: AppPerAdvSetAdValue

briefdescription.para: Set the value of an advertising data element in the periodic advertising data. If the element already exists in the data then it is replaced with the new value. If the element does not exist in the data it is appended to it, space permitting.

detaileddescription.para: There is special handling for the device name (AD type DM_ADV_TYPE_LOCAL_NAME). If the name can only fit in the data if it is shortened, the name is shortened and the AD type is changed to DM_ADV_TYPE_SHORT_NAME.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the value. Maximum length is 31 bytes if advertising set uses legacy advertising PDUs with extended advertising.

simplesect.para: true if the element was successfully added to the data, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Update the Advertising DID of the periodic advertising (the behavior is the same as if the current periodic advertising data had been sent again).

description.para: configure and enable legacy and extended scanning and periodic synch.

briefdescription.para: Start scanning. A scan is performed using the given discoverability mode, scan type, and duration.

parameterdescription.para: The scan duration, in milliseconds. If set to zero, scanning will continue until AppScanStop() is called.

briefdescription.para: Stop scanning.
Resolve the advertiser's RPA (AdvA) or the initiator's RPA (InitA) of a directed advertisement report. If the addresses resolved then a connection will be initiated.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to DM callback event message.
Which address in advertising report to be resolved.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t scanPhys, uint8_t mode, const uint8_t *pScanType, uint16_t duration, uint16_t period)
memberdef.name: AppExtScanStart

briefdescription.para: Start scanning. A scan is performed using the given scanner PHYs, discoverability mode, scan type, duration, and period.

parameterdescription.para: The scan duration, in milliseconds. If set to zero or both duration and period set to non-zero, scanning will continue until DmExtScanStop() is called.
The scan period, in 1.28 sec units. Set to zero to disable periodic scanning.

briefdescription.para: Stop scanning.
Get a stored scan result from the scan result list. The first result is at index zero.

parameterdescription.para: Index of result in scan result list.

simplesect.para: Pointer to scan result device info or NULL if index contains no result.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of stored scan results.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advSid, uint8_t advAddrType, const uint8_t *pAdvAddr, uint16_t skip, uint16_t syncTimeout, uint8_t syncCteType)
memberdef.name: AppSyncStart

briefdescription.para: Synchronize with periodic advertising from the given advertiser, and start receiving periodic advertising packets.

parameterdescription.para: Number of periodic advertising packets that can be skipped after successful receive.
Synchronization timeout, in the units of 10ms.
Whether to only synchronize to periodic advertising with certain types of Constant Tone Extension (0 indicates that the presence or absence of a Constant Tone Extension is irrelevant).

briefdescription.para: Stop reception of the periodic advertising identified by the given sync identifier.
Open a connection to a peer device with the given address.
Close a connection with the given connection identifier.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t initPhys, uint8_t addrType, uint8_t *pAddr, appDbHdl_t dbHdl)
memberdef.name: AppExtConnOpen

briefdescription.para: Open a connection to a peer device with the given address.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t advHandle, uint8_t subevent, uint8_t addrType, uint8_t *pAddr, appDbHdl_t dbHdl)
memberdef.name: AppPawrConnOpen

briefdescription.para: Open a connection to a peer device with the given address from a periodic advertisement.
Check if a connection is open.

simplesect.para: Connection ID of open connection or DM_CONN_ID_NONE if no open connections.

briefdescription.para: Gets a list of connection identifiers of open connections.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer to hold connection IDs (must be DM_CONN_MAX bytes).

briefdescription.para: Find the connection ID with matching handle.

simplesect.para: Connection ID or DM_CONN_ID_NONE if error.

description.para: Security and Bonding functions for configuration and interaction with STACK_SMP Pairing procedures.

briefdescription.para: Set the bondable mode of the device.

parameterdescription.para: true to set device to bondable, false to set to non-bondable.

briefdescription.para: Initiate security as a master device. If there is a stored encryption key for the peer device this function will initiate encryption, otherwise it will initiate pairing.
Initiate a request for security as a slave device. This function will send a message to the master peer device requesting security. The master device should either initiate encryption or pairing.
Handle a passkey request during pairing. If the passkey is to be displayed, a random passkey is generated and displayed. If the passkey is to be entered the user is prompted to enter the passkey.
Handle a numeric comparison indication during pairing. The confirmation value is displayed and the user is prompted to verify that the local and peer confirmation values match.

description.para: Process received messages for which there is a general process.

briefdescription.para: Process connection-related DM messages for a slave. This function should be called from the application's event handler.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to DM callback event message.

briefdescription.para: Process security-related DM messages for a slave. This function should be called from the application's event handler.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to DM callback event message.

briefdescription.para: Process connection-related DM messages for a master. This function should be called from the application's event handler.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to DM callback event message.

briefdescription.para: Process security-related DM messages for a master. This function should be called from the application's event handler.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to DM callback event message.

briefdescription.para: Application Server initialization routine.

ATT connection callback for app framework. This function is used when the application is operating as an ATT server and it uses notifications or indications. This function can be called by the application's ATT connection callback or it can be installed as the ATT connection callback.
Process ATT messages.
Process DM messages.

description.para: GATT Service Discovery initialization, configuration and execution.

briefdescription.para: Initialize app framework discovery.
Register a callback function to service discovery status.
Set the discovery cached handle list for a given connection.

parameterdescription.para: Length of characteristic and handle lists.

briefdescription.para: Service discovery or configuration procedure complete.

memberdef.name: AppDiscConfigure

briefdescription.para: Configure characteristics for discovered services.

Perform the GATT service changed procedure. This function is called when an indication is received containing the GATT service changed characteristic. This function may initialize the discovery state and initiate service discovery and configuration.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to ATT callback event message containing received indication.

briefdescription.para: Start GATT discovery or configuration.

simplesect.para: For automatic GATT discovery, AppDiscProcDmMsg should be used. This function may be called to perform additional discovery.

briefdescription.para: Process discovery-related DM messages. This function should be called from the application's event handler.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to DM callback event message.

briefdescription.para: Process discovery-related ATT messages. This function should be called from the application's event handler.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to ATT callback event message.

briefdescription.para: Get the handle range of the latest service discovery operation.

detaileddescription.para: May be called after receiving a APP_DISC_CMPL event, but before calling AppDiscComplete().

simplesect.para: true if handles were set, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Read peer's database hash.

description.para: Maintain privacy information about known peer devices.

briefdescription.para: Add device to resolving list.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to DM callback event message.

briefdescription.para: Add next device to resolving list. For the first device, the function should be called with 'hdl' set to 'APP_DB_HDL_NONE'.

parameterdescription.para: The last handle returned by AppAddNextDevToResList or APP_DB_HDL_NONE to begin.

simplesect.para: The handle being restored or APP_DB_HDL_NONE when the operation is complete.
Applications supporting address resolution should call this functions after DmDevReset. This function will restore the resolving list in the Controller using information in the app device database.

After each device is added to resolving list, the DM will send DM_PRIV_ADD_DEV_TO_RES_LIST_IND to the application. The application must call AppAddNextDevToResList again to continue the restore process until AppAddNextDevToResList returns APP_DB_HDL_NONE.

briefdescription.para: Clear all bonding information.

detaileddescription.para:
None.
\Note This API should not be used when:
Advertising (other than periodic advertising) is enabled,
Scanning is enabled, or
(Extended) Create connection or Create Sync command is outstanding.
Otherwise, clearing the resolving list in the Controller may fail.

briefdescription.para: Update privacy mode for a given peer device.

description.para: Discoverable/connectable mode used by function AppAdvStart.

detaileddescription.para: Automatically configure mode based on bonding info

briefdescription.para: Number of Discoverable/connectable modes.
Advertising states.
Advertising and scan data storage locations.
Service discovery and configuration client status.

detaileddescription.para: Do nothing - app will handle incoming request

briefdescription.para: Actions for incoming requests.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* appDiscCback_t) (dmConnId_t connId, uint8_t status)
memberdef.name: appDiscCback_t

briefdescription.para: Service discovery and configuration callback.
This is a pointer to the advertising configurable parameters used by the application. If advertising is used, the application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the extended advertising configurable parameters used by the application. If extended advertising is used, the application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the periodic advertising with response configuration used by the application. If PAWR advertising is used, the application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the slave configurable parameters used by the application. If slave mode is used, the application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the master configurable parameters used by the application. If master mode is used, the application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the extended master configurable parameters used by the application. If master mode is used, the application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the security-related configurable parameters used by the application. The application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the connection parameter update parameters used by the application. The application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the discovery parameters used by the application. The application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the application parameters used by the application. The application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the master incoming request actions used by the application. The application must set this variable during system initialization.
This is a pointer to the master incoming request actions used by the application. The application must set this variable during system initialization.
Number of advertising configurations.

detaileddescription.para: Resolving RPA the directed advertisement is being directed to (InitA)

briefdescription.para: Number of scan results to store (used only when operating as master)
